page.title: 01The Kilpeck and Orcop area
page.content: This area consists mostly of livestock farms producing milk, beef cattle and sheep. The predominant crop being grass but some cereals and root crops are grown. Because the farms are mostly smallish, so also are the fields and the area therefore has many hedgerows. Towards the south east there is a large area of woodland, mostly deciduous and the remainder has many small woods, spinneys and hedgerow trees inhabited by a profusion of wild life. The many hills and valleys provide outstanding panoramic views. Kilpeck village lies in the NW and is known for iits small Norman church with its stone carvings. Nearby are the remains of a Norman castle and earthworks indicare the site of a Mediaeval village. The village of Orcop lies to the south west.
